hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
GIT_BRANCH_SHORT=`echo ${GIT_BRANCH} | cut -d "/" -f 2` GIT_COMMIT_SHORT=`echo ${GIT_COMMIT} | cut -c1-7`
# This is done because we need artifacts created during the PIC-SURE API Build, and they are only available in our local .m2 cp -r /root/.m2 .m2
docker build -f docker/pic-sure-hpds/Dockerfile -t hms-dbmi/pic-sure-hpds:${GIT_BRANCH_SHORT}_${GIT_COMMIT_SHORT} . docker build -f docker/pic-sure-hpds-etl/Dockerfile -t hms-dbmi/pic-sure-hpds-etl:${GIT_BRANCH_SHORT}_${GIT_COMMIT_SHORT} .
mkdir -p docker_image_output cd docker_image_output docker save hms-dbmi/pic-sure-hpds:${GIT_BRANCH_SHORT}_${GIT_COMMIT_SHORT} | gzip > pic-sure-hpds.tar.gz aws s3 --sse=AES256 cp pic-sure-hpds.tar.gz s3://$S3_BUCKET_NAME/$TARGET_STACK/containers/pic-sure-hpds.tar.gz docker save hms-dbmi/pic-sure-hpds-etl:${GIT_BRANCH_SHORT}_${GIT_COMMIT_SHORT} | gzip > pic-sure-hpds-etl.tar.gz aws s3 --sse=AES256 cp pic-sure-hpds-etl.tar.gz s3://$S3_BUCKET_NAME/$TARGET_STACK/containers/pic-sure-hpds-etl.tar.gz
